programme.title: Heartland

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "The Road Home" - Amy finds herself overwhelmed after promising to "de-sensitize" three horses for the local police. Amy returns the last of Ty's things and he continues down his road of confusion.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "Leap of Faith" - When famous Olympic trainer Stewart Forrest hires Amy to coach his Olympic hopeful daughter, Amy feels that he's pushing her and her horse too hard. Ty is concerned when Amy asks Chase for help again.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "The River" - Bad publicity from Stewart Forrest's lawsuit against Amy has everyone at Heartland concerned. When Chase pulls his horses from training, Ty lends Amy his support and Lou does a little investigating.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "Never Surrender" - Caleb's rodeo buddy Bryce returns from Afghanistan in a wheelchair and asks Amy to get his horse back into good condition so that he can sell it, but Amy would rather convince him to try riding again.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "Burning Down the House" - Tim and his girlfriend announce they are selling the ranch and moving to California, but one of Tim's old girlfriends comes back and claims that Tim is the father of her son.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "Passages" - Amy and Ty work through their trust issues as they train a pair of Clydesdales. A horse-crazed boy and his mom show up at Heartland and Tim learns about a son he never knew he had.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "Finding Freedom" - Amy meets a professional liberty horse trainer and is inspired to take her horsemanship to a new level. A leaky roof forces Amy and Ty to move into Ashley and Caleb's trailer.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "Something in the Night" - Jack shanghais Tim, taking him to Moosejaw to confront his ex-girlfriend and son. Meanwhile, Amy is left to confront Janice about how to train the new racehorse.

programme.title: Heartland
programme.desc: "What's in a Name?" - Peter and Lou bring the baby back to Heartland and invite the in-laws to the naming ceremony. Scott drops by Ty's new place with a motorcycle requiring some work.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: "Episode 2" - Four days in, and the latest batch of plucky Brits to brave the island are already struggling. There's £100 000 to be found, hidden in the jungle, but the group are busy battling sleep deprivation thanks to an insect infestation in camp. When plumber Jack wrestles a half dead iguana from the grip of a python to provide a much-needed meal, the mood is momentarily lifted. Only to come crashing down again when the islanders realise their water source is running dry.

programme.desc: Call Me Troy is a truly inspirational story about a remarkable and dynamic individual whose activism was decades ahead of its time. Rev. Perry is perhaps best known as the founder of the Metropolitan Community Church - the first church to recognize the spiritual needs of the gay community - but his "firsts" don't stop there. In 1969, Perry performed the first public same-sex wedding in the U.S. setting the stage for a lifetime of activism of behalf of the LGBT+ community.

programme.desc: In June 1977, Director Arthur J. Bressan, Jr. mobilized camera crews across the country to document National Gay Freedom Day marches. Gay USA conveys the passion, anger, and defiant optimism of a community under attack, and illustrates the triumphant power of love and pride. Beautifully restored in 2K by the UCLA Film & Television Archive in collaboration with Frameline and Outfest.

programme.desc: "The Things Men Do" - It is 3am and Deputy Torres is cruising a Texas highway when he suddenly spots a crushed pick-up truck along the side of the road. Trapped inside is the lifeless body of 24-year-old Luis Reyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Truth of the Matter" - Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Paths of Destruction" - It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Needle in the Haystack" - Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Lingering Question" - When the husband, Tao Chen, is shot to death by his wife Jun, she claims she pulled the trigger in self-defense when a drunken Tao came after her with a gun.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Kiss of Death?" - After a brief illness, 34-year old Claire Jackson dies suddenly in the hospital from massive liver failure and winds up in Dr. G's morgue.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: The doctors at the hospital couldn't determine the cause of Bobby Curley's hallucinations and intense pain. They treated it as a neurological disorder but his condition deteriorated. He was being poisoned.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Who was the sexual offender who murdered two adolescent boys in Nebraska? The key to stopping him would be the unique composition of the "junk rope" he used to tie his victims.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Janice Johnson was found dead at the foot of her basement stairs. Police in Nova Scotia had to unravel the circumstances surrounding Janice's death and answer the question: Was it an accident or murder?

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: In 1996, more than a dozen children in Seattle, Washington, were fighting for their lives. Each one of them had contracted a serious unknown illness. After one died, investigators knew the clock was ticking.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Fire engulfs the home where Lori Keidel and her siblings were left alone while their father went to the laundromat. Years after her mother's disappearance, Lori tells police she witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Young Navajos in the Southwest were dying at an alarming rate. The tribe's medicine men provided investigators with a critical clue that would lead halfway around the world to a most unlikely killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Women in a Louisiana city live in fear of a rapist who leaves no clues to his identity. But technology and behavioral science combine to give police a new forensic tool. Police narrow their search to one man: local policeman Randy Comeaux.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When the wife of a well-known dentist is found dead, police struggle to identify a suspect. Some fibers and a study of the weather patterns on the night of the murder break the case open and reveal the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When Joann Katrinak is found dead in a corn field with her infant son, the obvious suspect is the husband and father of the victims. But insects found on the bodies reveal a vital clue which uncovers a twisted story of passion gone wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When a policeman's house goes up in flames, experts suspect arson. The officer whose home was torched arrests low-level drug dealer James Wren, who confesses. But when the suspect vanishes, investigators question the authenticity of the confession.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Nancy Newman and her two daughters are found brutally murdered. The crime scene has no shortage of evidence, but investigators cannot find a conclusive link to their prime suspect. To solve the puzzle, an FBI analyst designs a unique experiment.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When police find the body of 11-year-old Krista Harrison, there are few clues to the killer's identity. But authorities are intrigued by unusual orange fibers embedded in clothing found near the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: This examination of the role autopsies play in murder investigations focuses on the suspicious death of Virginia Ridley. Police charge her mentally unstable husband with murder, but a medical examiner discovers that she died of natural causes.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When the decomposed body of a teenage girl is discovered, police have no clues to her identity. To solve the case, investigators turn to bug larvae found on the body and a tiny wad of chewing gum found near the victim's body.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Police suspect Dr. John "Jack" Boyle in the disappearance of his wife, Noreen, when he signs mortgage papers for a new house with a woman pretending to be his spouse. The police later find Noreen's body in the basement of Dr. Boyle's new house.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Survivors of Nazi atrocities recognized Archbishop Trifa, former head of the Romanian Orthodox Church in America, as having directed a bloody attack against Jews during World War II. He was deported in 1984 and died three years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: In this international case of extortion, murder and stolen identities, scam-artist Albert J. Walker assumes the identity of co-worker Ronald Platt. Platt later turns up dead in an ocean with an anchor tied around his torso.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: "Teams faceoff in Blackjack as tensions begin to rise and a players confidence begins to dwindle. Hosted by Tom Abbott and Stephanie Sparks from the IBEROSTAR Playa Paraiso Golf and Spa Resort."

programme.title: Swing Expedition with Chris Como
programme.desc: "Chris travels to Dallas National Golf Club and spends a day with multiple-time PGA Tour winner Bryson DeChambeau and his long-time coach, Mike Schy. Bryson explains the origin of his single-length clubs and the mechanics he learned at a young age."

programme.title: Swing Expedition with Chris Como

programme.title: The Food Ranger

Finally, test cook Tim Chin shows host Julia Collin Davison how to make perfect Lemon Posset with Berries.

programme.title: Grown Up Comfort Classics
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison unlock the secrets to Simple Stovetop Macaroni and Cheese. Science expert Dan Souza explains the proper way to use a whisk. In the Equipment Corner, expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for large saucepans. Next, test cook Becky Hays makes the perfect Turkey Meatloaf with Ketchup-Brown Sugar Glaze. Finally, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews lid holders.

programme.title: Modern Weeknight Meals
programme.desc: Modern Weeknight Meals Test cook Becky Hays makes Bridget the perfect One-Hour Broiled Chicken and Pan Sauce. In the Equipment Corner, expert Adam Ried reviews blenders, and then test cook Tim Chin wraps up the episode by making Julia the ultimate Modern Cauliflower Gratin.

programme.title: Sous Vide for Everybody
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Bridget Sous Vide Seared Steaks. Equipment expert Adam Ried then reviews his top pick for sous vide machines, and test cook Elle Simone makes a show stopping sous vide staple: Soft-Poached Eggs.

programme.title: Beef Burgundy
programme.desc: We uncover the secrets to beef Burgundy at its best and show you a way to make portions of it ahead of time.

programme.title: Fried Rice and Kung Pao Shrimp
programme.desc: We show you how to prepare fried rice and kung pao shrimp. Our findings about rice cookers and long-grain white rice guarantee perfect rice every time.

programme.title: Showstopper Desserts
programme.desc: When entertaining, we like desserts that look more complicated to prepare than they really are. A chocolate mousse cake requires a minimum of ingredients and comes together in minutes, but it is sure to elicit the proper oohs and aahs from guests. And a chilled lemon soufflé is made from basic ingredients that you probably have in your kitchen right now.

programme.title: Summer Tomatoes
programme.desc: What's the best way to enjoy summer tomatoes? It's hard to argue with a recipe that goes something like this: Slice, salt, and serve. Still, there are times when you want to use tomatoes in more elaborate dishes, and gazpacho and a cheesy tart are two of our favorites.

programme.title: Appetizers
programme.desc: We like appetizers that deliver big flavor without much work. This means spiced nuts that are not overly sweet, spinach dip that is bold and creamy (not watery and insipid), and beef satay that is tender and vibrant.

programme.title: Let's Talk Turkey
programme.desc: Thanksgiving can strike fear into the heart of even the most proficient cook. First, there's the turkey to contend with-in no other meal is the main course paraded in front of guests with as much fanfare. Sweet potato casserole is often considered another must-have. With our recipes for these Thanksgiving standards, we minimize the work so that the cook can enjoy the holiday as much as everyone else.

programme.title: Grilled Pizza
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grill-one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Prime & Proper Andiamo's One-Eyed Betty’s
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Chris Guyor, Nailah Ellis-Brown and Niki Calme, who review sophisticated specialties at the Prime & Proper Steakhouse original Italian recipes at the iconic Andiamo restaurant and favorite dishes - and beer - at the New Orleans' influenced, One-Eyed Betty's.

programme.title: Graham Kerrs Kitchen - Spaghetti Salmonara
programme.desc: Fresh, clean and sweet: a quick, fresh tomato sauce is tossed with tender pink salmon chinks, pasta and cheese.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Lanai
programme.desc: The smallest of Hawaii’s seven main islands, Lanai’s deer population outnumbers local residents. Lanai game manager Gary Onuma leads Hawaii Cooks on a search for the island's famed Axis deer. On the hunt, Onuma takes viewers through Lanai's upcountry pine forests and into the remote backcountry.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Boiled Brisket of Beef & White Beans
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Boiled Brisket of Beef & White Beans!

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Baked Fish
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking baked fish, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Peter de Jong, Pierre Pollin, and Shane Gorringe
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Benne Seed Shrimp and Crab Cakes, Sturgeon Napoleon with Foie Gras, and Chocolate Demerara. Restaurants include: Beaufort Inn in Beaufort, Le Titi de Paris in Arlington Heights, and Zoë’s in Covington.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Peace and Autonomy
programme.desc: Chef Walter Staib travels deep into the mountains of Jamaica for an incredible glimpse into the world of the Maroons of Accompong Town. The village Deputy Chief/Medicine Man and Chef Staib roast a traditional whole jerk pig and a savor pepper pot soup.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Prime & Proper Andiamo's One-Eyed Betty’s
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Chris Guyor, Nailah Ellis-Brown and Niki Calme, who review sophisticated specialties at the Prime & Proper Steakhouse original Italian recipes at the iconic Andiamo restaurant and favorite dishes - and beer - at the New Orleans' influenced, One-Eyed Betty's.

programme.title: Graham Kerrs Kitchen - Spaghetti Salmonara
programme.desc: Fresh, clean and sweet: a quick, fresh tomato sauce is tossed with tender pink salmon chinks, pasta and cheese.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Milking Goodness
programme.desc: James Beard award winner Craig Stoll is serious about knowing exactly where his ingredients come from. Chef insists on meeting “the ladies” a herd of Holstein cows that provide milk for one of his favorite cheeses, Point Reyes Original Blue Farmstead Cheese. After milking the herd, he heads into the kitchen to prepare his famous Neapolitan pizza’s.

programme.title: Foodie Road Trip with Skye Estroff - The A-Z of Alpharetta
programme.desc: Learn what it takes to make the best shrimp & grits, red velvet cake, and deviled eggs in Alpharetta. Skye takes a creative spin on a favorite blueberry recipe with some help from a local.

programme.title: From Scratch - Pizza
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe prepares fresh cheese and sausages for a PIZZA party with friends and family.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - The Long Walk
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Laurence Jossel, chef and owner of Nopa. Like Cecilia, South African-born Jossel came a long way to open a restaurant in San Francisco. Cecilia shows Laurence how to make “beggar’s chicken,” a whole, stuffed chicken wrapped in lotus leaves and then clay, and baked for at least two hours.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - The Ocean
programme.desc: Nick describes how growing up surrounded by the ocean and trips to the California Coastline inspire his recipes. Dishes include: Swordfish "Agrodolce" (Swordfish in a Sweet and Sour Sicilian Sauce) / Scallop with Red Pepper Zucchini Cream Sauce / Calamari with Sun Dried Tomatoes and Garbanzo Beans.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Festival of the Seven Fishes
programme.desc: Mayor of Boston, the late (and great) Thomas M. Menino and Mary Ann celebrate their Italian American heritage by preparing a Christmas Eve banquet called “The Feast of the Seven Fishes.” Starting with Baccalà, then Skillet Fried Shrimp, then tuna, smelts, swordfish, calamari and clams, the tradition continues, and so do their appetites!

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Portuguese Influence
programme.desc: Martin explores the effect of the Portuguese influence on Chinese cooking in Macau, dines outdoors in the European style, and visits the “Miss Macau” restaurant. This episode's recipes include: Beauty Queen Beef, Spicy Clams with Pork Sausage, and Macau Clay Pot with Rice.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Out Of Africa
programme.desc: The focus is on Africa where live fire cooking began. Recipes include: Piri Piri Wings, Cape Malay Sosaties and Kenyan Lamb.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Primavera
programme.desc: Simple dishes show off the flavor of new peas and asparagus. We'll make a Cheater's Chicken Stock (when there's no homemade stock on hand), a bright green Spring Pea Soup, a quick, tender and lemony Peas and Cipolline dish, and Halibut with Asparagus and Salsa Genovese. We'll see the vineyards of the wine country covered in golden mustard blossoms, and drop in on the Mustard Festival.

programme.title: Lucky Chow
programme.desc: The expanding borders of Chinatown and the future of legacies like Nom Wah Tea Parlor, with Wilson Tang and Jonathan Wu. Peking Duck with Ed Schoenfeld and Joe Ng. Hakkasan globalizes China chic, thanks to Alan Lau.

programme.title: Lucky Chow
programme.desc: Lucky Chow goes on a tasty adventure showcasing Taiwan’s incredible food and culture.

programme.title: Lucky Chow
programme.desc: Lucky Chow spends time with three entrepreneurs who are bringing Vietnamese flavors into the mainstream.

programme.title: Lucky Chow
programme.desc: Lucky Chow highlights the food world’s newest rockstars: farmers who grow the food that ends up on our plates.

programme.title: Lucky Chow
programme.desc: Lucky Chow discovers the culinary delights found in Asian houses of worship across America.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal
programme.desc: Kolkata, the first stop of Pablo's journey and the gastronomical capital of India. Pablo explores the streets, local markets and meets a lot of exciting people who give him a taste of the regions cuisine.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal
programme.desc: The Monpa Tribe are the corn farmers who reside in this small, beautiful village of Dirang. The mountain slopes and the corn harvest remind Pablo of his home and the comfort food warm his soul.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal
programme.desc: Pablo steps foot in one of the most remote parts of the Arunachal Pradesh, the Lubrang Valley, which shelters the Brokpa Tribe and their yaks from the very unpredictable weather.

programme.title: Gourmet Goes Tribal
programme.desc: Tawang is synonymous with Buddhism with its magnificent monastery set among the Himalayas. Paul's journey takes him to meet with monks, pay respects at a centuries-old stupa and cook with nuns.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: Arriving in Darwin, Abbey hits the ground running thirsty, and keen to find the coldest beer in the territory, goes on a pub crawl by helicopter. Feeling like a refreshing swim, she jumps into the Cage of Death, sharing the pool with a massive saltwater croc.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: In the rugged plains of the Top End, Abbey joins good friend Matt Wright. They fend off an extremely feisty female croc, Sweet Thing. Abbey also meets some of his best mates along the journey, who just so happen to be about 17 foot long.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: Abbey teams up with DEMED Rangers and Traditional Land Owners in West Arnhem to see everything the region has to offer.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: Abbey travels to one of her favourite regions in the Northern Territory, paying a visit to her good friend Larry Guruwiwi.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: Abbey faces her fears and cage dives with ferocious tiger sharks. Back on land, she visits the local market for a tasty mango smoothie treat.

programme.title: Into the Outback with Abbey Holmes
programme.desc: As her adventure comes to an end, Abbey tries to catch the elusive barramundi one last time.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: Nairobi is known as a hard city, full of crime and political corruption, yet it’s as cosmopolitan and as cultured as it gets. In order to get to the heart of what it means to be Kenyan, David meets an eclectic variety of local artists and entrepreneurs who open his eyes to the joys, the challenges, and the vibrancy of life in the city and in the ghetto. Through music, art and performance, the people of Nairobi showcase their passions and heritage.

programme.title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa
programme.desc: The Rocco family journeys into the Maasai Mara to have a truly unique and life-changing experience: a Safari adventure to top anyone’s bucket list. They learn a thing or two about the circle of life, and spend a day with the nomadic Maasai tribe in their village. David gets a first-hand lesson in what it’s like to be a traditional Maasai warrior, from their roles in the community, to their rituals, and finally to their feasts.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - NY Classics!
programme.desc: Kyle visits with his friend and rising star, Bridget Everett and takes her to an East Village staple, the quirky Ray's Belgian French Fry shop that epitomizes old New York City.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - The Queer Interior!
programme.desc: Kyle's friend Douglas Calhoun, creator of the Queer Interior website, visits Kyle's apartment and collection.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - The Haarcut
programme.desc: Kyle visits his good friend, ragtime barber, Michael Haar's apartment in Queens to see his vintage phonograph and barber shop collection, and a get a new 'do.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - Drawn Me In!
programme.desc: Kyle visits his friend, blind-contour illustrator Ian Sklarsky, and both pay a visit to veteran illustrator Robert. W Richards.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - Flea Is Me
programme.desc: Kyle visits his favorite flea market, the Chelsea Flea Market, to see what New York characters are visiting on it's final weekend inside The Garage.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - Bear With Me!
programme.desc: We venture to Staten Island to make a meal with the "Bearmallow" creator and chef, R. Bear Karito.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - I Lava NY!
programme.desc: Fellow collector Bryin Dall shows Kyle around his amazing collection of mid-century lighting, lava lamps, and fantastic plastics.

programme.title: Kyle Supley's Out There - The Jazz Age Lawn Party!
programme.desc: Kyle meets up with his friends, the crew behind the very vintage Jazz Age Lawn Party held each year at New York's Governor's Island.

programme.title: Journy World Docs - Easter Island: Mysteries of a Lost World
programme.desc: The contrast between the majestic statues of Easter Island and the desolation of their surroundings is stark. For decades, Easter Island has been seen as a warning for the planet as a whole: exhaust natural resources and the collapse of civilisation is inevitable. But Dr Jago Cooper believes that this is a disastrous misreading of what happened on Easter Island. Far from being a failure, the culture was a success story - and the real reasons for its demise were not the actions of its people.

programme.title: The Da Vinci List Chefs - The Da Vinci List Chefs
programme.desc: Meet the modern culinary artists who have transformed their fields.

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Walt Disney World Resort
programme.desc: Donna enjoys the fun, luxury and adventure of the Walt Disney World Resort. While there, she will explore the vast variety of Walt Disney World's Resort Collection including the Cinderella Castle suite, ride shotgun in a real race car as well as play volleyball with Goofy!!!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Disney Cruise Line
programme.desc: Donna experiences the luxury and family-friendliness of Disney Cruise Line's, Disney Wonder. While aboard, she experiences a unique balcony spa treatment, a cooking demonstration with the Disney Wonder's Executive Chef as well as enjoying a first in the cruising industry, a fireworks show on the high seas - all done in grand Disney style!!!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Quebec City, Canada
programme.desc: Back to the snow Donna goes - but this time, she explores North America's oldest city and experiences local culture & cuisine as well as the city's most renowned hotel. PLUS - she'll visit the Ice Hotel!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Ocho Rios, Jamaica
programme.desc: Donna visits Ocho Rios, Jamaica and will explore the history, amazing culture, adventure and an amazing family focused resort. She'll also highlight a wonderful Jam-Italian fusion restaurant that is a MUST when visiting Ocho Rios!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Montego Bay, Jamaica
programme.desc: Donna visits Montego Bay & Negril where she will continue her exploration of Jamaica. In this episode, the Rose Hall Great House and its mysterious past are highlighted as well as Cliff Diving and Zip Lining. In addition, Donna will take a tour of the beautiful Half Moon Resort where she will learn more about her accommodations as well as learn how to golf and swim with a horse!

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Montreal, Canada
programme.desc: Donna visits Montreal and will explore some of the great Quebecois cultural and epicurean wonders of this amazing metropolitan city. In addition she will try jet boating as well as learn more about why Montreal the unofficial "world headquarters" for the circus arts.

programme.title: Andiamo! UPTOWN - Catalina Island, California
programme.desc: In this episode, Donna journey's to one of California's most unique islands for some horseback riding, history, art and a bevy of food!

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh and Matt Altman land the biggest mansion in Bradbury Estates. Madison battles structural problems and mold to sell a friend's house in Brentwood.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After being hired by a hard-nosed client who used to be a top real estate agent, James and David come up with a brilliant strategy to impress him. Josh Flagg is frustrated when he gets the listing for one of his favorite properties only to find out that other agents don't share his appreciation for it. programme.desc: Josh Altman battles his own client. Josh Flagg makes a big decision. Madison hustles to help a client downsize, but has trouble holding her attention.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Altman and his brother Matt meet with an international client demanding they find the perfect Beverly Hills getaway in just two days. programme.desc: James works hard to sell a home to vocal superstar Kelly Rowland. Flagg gets creative to sell a Bel Air pad built for Robby Kreiger (guitarist for The Doors).

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Andre & Joy Belinda & Jerry
programme.desc: Two weddings showcase Central Park & the site of the 1964 World's Fair. But there's plenty of drama, including a hungover groom, a bus breakdown, missing bridesmaids, and an ominous approaching storm.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Alison & Skip Linda & Curtis
programme.desc: In Washington Square Park, Gino marries a bride who was married to a woman to a man. An Asian-American bride defies her parents and marries her African-American husband in a checkered taxi.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Melissa & Jerry, Lisa & Ross
programme.desc: For New Yorkers Melissa and Jerry, Gino secures a picturesque wedding location under the Brooklyn Bridge. Ross is a bachelor and Lisa's a fourth time bride, but their rooftop wedding is a perfect fit.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Sade & Aaron Kira & Damien
programme.desc: Sade and Aaron are too busy to plan their own wedding, while Kira and Damien have all the time in the world. But Gino wows Sade with an elegant rooftop wedding, while giving Kira and Damien the beach ceremony they dreamed of.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Cassaundra & Joko Katie & Tim
programme.desc: Cassaundra & Joko want to marry at the Top of the Rock, but their guest list is too large & Gino needs to find an alternative. Katie & Tim want a church wedding, but Gino convinces them that Times Square would be more their style.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Abigail & David Meritza & Kyle
programme.desc: Gino marries stylish couple Meritza & Kyle on a runway during a fashion show. Abigail & David have never been to NYC, but dream about being married there, and Gino scores them a location in the iconic Grand Central Station.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Andre & Joy Belinda & Jerry
programme.desc: Two weddings showcase Central Park & the site of the 1964 World's Fair. But there's plenty of drama, including a hungover groom, a bus breakdown, missing bridesmaids, and an ominous approaching storm.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Alison & Skip Linda & Curtis
programme.desc: In Washington Square Park, Gino marries a bride who was married to a woman to a man. An Asian-American bride defies her parents and marries her African-American husband in a checkered taxi.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Melissa & Jerry, Lisa & Ross
programme.desc: For New Yorkers Melissa and Jerry, Gino secures a picturesque wedding location under the Brooklyn Bridge. Ross is a bachelor and Lisa's a fourth time bride, but their rooftop wedding is a perfect fit.

programme.title: Marry Me In NYC: Sade & Aaron Kira & Damien
programme.desc: Sade and Aaron are too busy to plan their own wedding, while Kira and Damien have all the time in the world. But Gino wows Sade with an elegant rooftop wedding, while giving Kira and Damien the beach ceremony they dreamed of.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Catch-Up with Mary Mary
programme.desc: Over the past three years, you've watched Mary Mary go through some of their highest highs and lowest lows. Catch up on all the fun and fiery drama and get a sneak peak of the craziest season yet.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Solo Sisters
programme.desc: Erica finds out how difficult a solo career can be without a manager & the Mary Mary budget. Tina stirs things up with Warryn and her record label by planning her solo project completely on her own.

programme.title: Mary Mary: A Tale of Two Tinas
programme.desc: While Erica is touring and unavailable for her sister, a frustrated "New" Tina tries to keep the "Old" Tina at bay while planning her wedding and meeting Teddy's estranged father for the very first time.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Hitched and Mitch'd
programme.desc: Tina & Teddy renew their vows in a stunning sunset ceremony. Teddy and daughter Laiah sing Tina's new songs. Mitchell confronts Erica at the wedding, infuriating Goo and Warryn.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Mary Mary Together Again
programme.desc: Erica desperately needs a vacation, so when Warryn cancels their getaway for a work trip in NYC, things get heated. But the real fireworks begin when Tina tells Erica it's time get Mary Mary back together.

programme.title: Mary Mary: I'm Gonna Kill Somebody!
programme.desc: Tina's confession on the radio about Teddy's infidelities leaves Erica panicked that her sister is hurting the Mary Mary brand. Tina's mess-up costs Warryn money, and Erica nearly collapses from exhaustion.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Twisted Sisters
programme.desc: Erica is forced to go to an event alone because Tina won't go. When Tina refuses to do Erica a favor, lines are drawn. Warryn pushes Erica to quit Mary Mary.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Sailing Apart
programme.desc: Mary Mary sets sail on a cruise, but Erica has decided it's time to end Mary Mary. When Tina resents the decision things get ugly between the sisters.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Out with a Bang!
programme.desc: The girls make their way to St. Louis for their farewell Mary Mary concert and tensions continue to grow between the two & Tina is MIA. Tina & Mitchell meet to discuss her solo project.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Life's a Mitch
programme.desc: Sisterly rivalry sets in when Erica is up for several Dove Awards. Meanwhile, Mitchell causes an uproar when he crashes Goo Goo's photo shoot, tries to get her fired & confronts Erica and Warryn.

programme.title: Mary Mary: Hail Mary
programme.desc: Erica and Tina both go after their solo projects full force, but Tina has an epic meltdown moments before her big solo show - only Teddy can help because Erica is on tour. Warryn gets an ominous call from Sony.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day One" - Twelve chefs begin their journeys for the final prize: an executive chef position at the newly opened Red Rock Casino, Resort and Spa in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Two" - After a disastrous opening night, both teams learn the hard way about the importance of restaurant service — by waiting on tables.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Three" - Frustrated after another lackluster dinner service, Chef Ramsay shares some of his experiences running a successful restaurant while setting the third night's competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Four" - Chef Ramsay ends the battle of the sexes, and "Hell's Kitchen" breaks new ground when the teams cook for an especially demanding group: children.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Five" - The fifth day commences with Chef Ramsay giving a lesson in the art of culinary flavor to the remaining contestants.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Six" - The six remaining chefs prepare original dishes, and the two teams devise their own menus for the night's dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Seven " - The budding chefs must work as individuals for the first time. The prize for this challenge is a trip with Chef Ramsay to the Red Rock Casino, Resort and Spa.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Eight" - With just four chefs remaining, the competition becomes fierce. Who among them has what it takes to be head chef at Gordon Ramsay's new restaurant?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Nine" - The contestants taste Chef Ramsay's signature dish and are given twenty minutes to replicate it. Tensions rise amongst the chefs amidst accusations of cheating.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 2, Day Ten (Part One)" - From the menu to the décor, the two finalists must prove their worth by running their own restaurants. Both will complete a dinner service with help from their former competitors.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: PJ's Steakhouse
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse, a restaurant that is dying due to management's lack of control and poor food quality.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited: Gordon Returns
programme.desc: When Chef Ramsay returns to Finn McCool's, The Olde Stone Mill, The Mixing Bowl, Dillon's, Campania's and Peter's, he finds restaurants saved from the brink of disaster.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Handlebar
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mount Sinai, New York to help spruce up Bill and Carolyn LeRoy's Handlebar restaurant and lounge, which looks like it's stuck in the 1980s.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Giuseppe's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay makes his way to Macomb Township, Michigan to inspect Giuseppe's, a family-run Italian restaurant afflicted with a bickering father-son duo and a shortage of customers.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Trobiano's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay tries to help Italian restaurant Trobiano's. When Ramsay confronts the owner about the cleanliness of the kitchen and the tastiness of the food, tensions rise.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Black Pearl
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Black Pearl, a seafood restaurant that has three owners, each running the kitchen in a different manner. This leads to a confused staff and variable quality in food.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: J. Willy's
programme.desc: Located in Indiana, J. Willy's Bar and Grille is deep in debt. When Chef Ramsay arrives, he challenges the owners to use fresh ingredients, but the inexperienced chefs get overwhelmed.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Hannah and Mason's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits French bistro Hannah and Mason's. Owned by two friends who lack business skills and motivation, the restaurant administers bounced checks to the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Jack's Waterfront
programme.desc: Ramsay arrives at Jack's Waterfront and is appalled by the lack of fresh seafood and inattentive management. The general manager's excessive socializing with patrons may sink the place.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sabatiello's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Sabatiello's and finds a hot-headed owner who is deep in debt. The owner gets so angry at his employees and Ramsay's criticism that he shuts down the eatery himself.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Priceless Runway" - With the help of Chopard, the designers are asked to create an extravagant eveningwear piece inspired by jewelry of their choosing. They also draw inspiration from the Charles James exhibit at the MET, and Tim decides to use his "Tim Gunn Save" on one designer.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Rainway" - Inspired by the latest Samsung Curved TV, the designers are asked to create avant-garde pieces that look good from every angle. The twist? The pieces also have to walk the Runway...in the rain! The designers have two days to put together a look that can wow the judges and withstand a "Rainway."

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "American Girl Doll" - After a field trip to the American Girl Store, the designers are asked to create a modern look for a young girl, inspired by the "Beforever" American Doll collection. The designers work with young girls as their models for this challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Muse On The Street" - For the Mary Kay Challenge, the designers are asked to find a complete stranger on the street to act as their muse (and model) for a makeover. The real women are given a makeup consult, new haircut, and new outfit. One designer runs into trouble with a zipper before the Runway, which leads to a controversial decision.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Highest Bidder" - The designers are taken to a large warehouse and told that for their next challenge, they will have to bid on storage units in order to obtain their materials. The designers work in teams of two to make a two-piece cohesive collection from the materials they buy. On the second day of their two-day challenge, Tim presents the designers with the task of designing one more look. When the judges cannot decide who to eliminate on the Runway, two designers face off in a one-hour showdown.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Fashion Week: Who's In and Who's Out " - The designers are asked to create a "Street Chic" look inspired by a trip around NYC, courtesy of Lexus. They are also thrown a twist...to redesign one of the "losing looks" this season, and their sewing helper is a previously eliminated designer.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 1" - Fashion week is just around the corner, but not before the final four designers are surprised with a trip to Rome, courtesy of Best Western. The designers join Tim in a trip of a lifetime, where they gain inspiration for their collections. Later, Tim visits each of the designers at home to check on their progress. The designers then return to NYC and present a preview of their collection to the judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 2" - The moment that our designers have been waiting and hoping for since the very beginning, the opportunity to show at New York Fashion Week, has finally arrived. With only four competitors remaining, who will ultimately have what it takes to win Project Runway?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Reunion Special" - All of the designers reunite one last time to discuss their experiences on Project Runway together, settle any last feuds that still exist in the group, and reminisce about their time on this season. Tim Gunn hosts.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Road to the Runway" - In this season's casting special, "Road to the Runway," sixteen new designers will be introduced with a behind-the-scenes look from their casting auditions, home visits, casting submissions, and sit-down interviews. Tim Gunn will present the designers in carefully carved out categories that will lead you into the season premiere.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Mad Dash Mayhem" - In the season premiere, sixteen new designers meet Tim and Heidi at Madison Square Garden, where they scramble across the seats to gather fabric for their first challenge. In the workroom, they reveal their strengths and weaknesses as they create looks to show who they are as designers.

programme.title: El Talisman
programme.desc: Tras perder un rancho en Texas, Camila Nájera y su familia se mudan a Fresno, California. El destino los llevará a ser vecinos del despiadado Gregorio Negrete, dueño del rancho "El Alcatraz". Gregorio ha vivido en guerra con Los Aceves, antiguos dueños de "El Talismán", y su único sueño es poseer ese rancho. Camila se verá envuelta en este juego de ambición y poder, que la lleva a conocer a dos hombres que le cambiarán la vida.

programme.title: El Show de Willi
programme.desc: Willi estrena su propio reality show. Todo el mundo está en vilo y pronto se revelará su verdadera intención.

programme.title: Jodha Akbar
programme.desc: Jodha Akbar es un drama épico ambientado en el siglo XVI que relata la historia sobre un matrimonio político de conveniencia entre un emperador mogol, Akbar y una princesa Rajput, Jodha Bai. La trama se centra en cómo éste matrimonio político trae el amor entre ellos en una medida que cambió el destino de la India, así mismo retrata las guerras de ese tiempo junto con las relaciones entre los mogoles y los Rajputs. Gran parte de la historia recrea el funcionamiento de las instituciones icónicas de la época como las reinas, los tribunales, las cortesanas, los ministros y su influencia en la historia de amor de Akbar y Jodha Bai. La serie también destaca cómo el Emperador Mogol Jalaluddin adquiere el título de Akbar del pueblo.

programme.title: Agua en la Boca
programme.desc: Es una historia de amor prohibido entre dos jóvenes, hijos de familias rivales. La hermosa Danielle Cassoulet (de descendencia francés) y el aventurero Luca Bellini (de descendencia italiana). El conflicto entre el cassoulet y la familia Bellini es viejo, siendo antes los mejores amigos de la juventud las matriarcas de esas familias hoy no pueden permanecer de pie debido a una disputa amorosa en el pasado en el que Françoise Cassoulet, y la abuela de Dany se peleaban por el amor de un mismo hombre.

programme.title: El Mono
programme.desc: A dos medio hermanas la vida les dará un giro radical luego de evento dramático.

programme.title: El Talisman
programme.desc: Tras perder un rancho en Texas, Camila Nájera y su familia se mudan a Fresno, California. Camila se verá envuelta en este juego de ambición y poder, que la lleva a conocer a dos hombres que le cambiarán la vida.

programme.title: Club De Señoritas
programme.desc: Una guerra entre el Club De Señoritas y el Club del Cha Cha Cha. Una lucha que enfrenta a hombres y mujeres para demostrar quienes mandan en el hogar.

programme.title: El Inolvidable Chucho El Roto
programme.desc: Chucho el Roto es un Robin Hood mexicano que durante la época porfirista roba a los ricos para proteger a los pobres.

programme.title: Santo contra el cerebro del mal
programme.desc: Un agente de la policía encubierta es secuestrado por el Dr. Campos quien le lava el cerebro para convertirlo en miembro de su pandilla.

programme.title: La Violetera
programme.desc: Soledad, Una Violetera Madrileña, Conoce A Fernando, Un Joven Aristócrata Que Se Enamora Perdidamente De Ella. Al Morir Su Hermano, Fernando Ha De Hacerse Cargo De Las Obligaciones De La Familia Y Renunciar Al Amor De Soledad Para Casarse Con La Novia Que Iba Destinada A Su Hermano, En Pro De Los Intereses Familiares. Pasados Los Anos Soledad Se Ha Convertido En Una Famosa Cantante Y Fernando Ha Obtenido Una Brillante Carrera Politica

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Soap Gets in Your Eyes" - Ann's role as a villainess in a soap opera compromises a potential relationship with Don's mother (Mabel Albertson). Will a visit from the actor playing the hero improve her image?

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "All About Ann" - Donald works with one of the actresses in Ann's workshop to do an article about her, but she thinks he's having an affair.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Phantom of the Horse Opera" - Ann's apartment building is being "haunted" by an old movie theater organist (Sterling Holloway).

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Beware of Actors Bearing Gifts" - A member of Ann's acting workshop tries to buy her friendship.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Christmas and the Hard-Luck Kid" - Ann tells Donald about her stint as a teacher in a boarding school, trying to bring good tidings and joy to a boy who won't be able to go home for Christmas.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Among My Souvenirs" - While sifting through boxes of souvenirs, Ann finds a ring given to her by a high school sweetheart and attempts to return it.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "These Boots Weren't Made for Walking" - Ann tries her luck as a traveling door-to-door saleswoman selling shoes. What her boss (Paul Lynde) doesn't tell her is that the shoes are made entirely from cardboard.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Kimono My House" - When Ann finds out how messy Don's apartment is, she hires a maid to help him clean the place up.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Gone with the Breeze" - Donald hands Ann the manuscript for a novel he wrote, which she is suddenly convinced she lost.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Rain, Snow and Rice" - At the Bauman's wedding in Connecticut, a snowstorm traps Ann, Don and their friends at the hotel, but only two rooms are available and Ann has no intention of sharing a bed with Donald.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Paper Hats and Everything" - While Ann expects a dinner date with her father to be a surprise birthday party, Judy assembles one on short notice just in case it isn't.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "What Are Your Intentions?" - Ann's father presses Donald as to whether he intends to marry his daughter.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "A Tenor's Loving Care" - A famous opera singer (Carroll O'Connor) makes a play for Ann while Don tries to get an interview with the temperamental celebrity.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Leaving the Nest Is for the Birds" - A family dinner put on by Ann to show that life in New York City is safe is spoiled by an alleged peeping Tom (Jerry Van Dyke).

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "You Have to Know Someone to Be Unknown" - Finding out that Broadway producer Harold J. Davis (Herbert Rudley) is seeking a fresh-faced unknown for his next play, Ann goes out of her way to get recognized by him.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Honeymoon Apartment" - Ann's cheap cousin (Warren Berlinger) and his brand new bride insist on using her apartment for their honeymoon.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "This Little Piggy Had a Ball" - While bowling with Donald just before she has to accept an award for another actress, Ann reads about another bowler who bowled with his toes...and makes the mistake of trying to do it herself.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Christopher Lawrence - Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Mark Christopher Lawrence (born May 22, 1964) is an American character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist. He is perhaps best known for his role as esoteric D.J., Tone Deaf, in the 1994 satirical rap mockumentary, Fear of a Black Hat. He has co-starred in popular films such as Terminator 2: Judgment Day, Planet of the Apes, Lost Treasure and The Pursuit of Happiness. Lawrence can currently be seen in his regular role as Big Mike on the NBC series Chuck. He has made guest appearances on many television programs, most notably Heroes, My Name Is Earl, Crossing Jordan, Dharma & Greg, Malcolm in the Middle, Touched by an Angel, Malcolm & Eddie, Men Behaving Badly, Seinfeld, Murphy Brown, and Martin. He is also featured on the Radio Series Adventures in Odyssey as "Ed Washington".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Sneed - Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Ohio, Josh comes to Dry Bar to bring “new life” to his comedy. Being funny 24/7 can be difficult, but Josh Sneed does it. Watch “Live in the Dessert” by Josh Sneed now!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Steve Soelberg - Pirate Hymns
programme.desc: Steve Soelberg might actually be a human ray of sunshine. Riffing on his ultra-conservative upbringing, this special balances jokes about the tune of church hymns with hilarious observations of the seemingly mundane.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: Brad Upton - Will Be Funny For Money
programme.desc: Brad Upton first stepped on stage in September of 1984 and he's never looked back. This ex-grade school teacher is now in his 30th year of comedy and is nearing 6000 lifetime performances. He is a past winner of the Las Vegas Comedy Festival and appeared recently at Caesar's Palace as part of the HBO Comedy Festival. He has spent the last eight years as the opening act for the legendary Johnny Mathis and did multiple shows all over the country with the late, great Joan Rivers. He has also been seen in concert with The Smothers Brothers, Smokey Robinson, Kenny Rogers, Dolly Parton, Lewis Black, George Jones, Glen Campbell, Pam Tillis and many others. Coast to coast all over North America isn't the only place Brad performs. In 2014 Brad headlined in Singapore, Hong Kong, The MGM in Macau and did eight nights in Israel as part of the Comedy for Koby benefit. His new CD entitled, "Brad Uptonogood" is heard regularly on Sirius Satellite Radio and is available online wherever music is sold. He also just released his first DVD entitled, "Brad Upton, Live from the 509".

programme.title: Ty Barnett - Yep
programme.desc: Ty Barnett, a Chicago native, got his start at Seattle’s Comedy Underground. Whoopi Goldberg called Ty “hilarious” and reviewers have said he is “thought provoking” and “edgy”. All this praise earned him many television appearances. He hosted the Food Network’s Mealin’ and Dealin’, Discovery Family’s Babies Behaving Badly and Beasts Behaving Badly, and appeared in over 15 national commercials. It all began when he was one of the two finalists on the most-watched and Emmy nominated season of Last Comic Standing. Ty went on to multiple Tonight Show appearances where Jay Leno called Ty “one of the funniest comedians working”. He also appeared in HBO’s Bad Boys of Comedy, his own Comedy Central Presents and one-hour special Issues. Ty was named “one to watch” by the Hollywood Reporter. He’s also been seen on the sitcoms Samantha Who, Til Death, Life in Pieces, NickMom Night Out and Tosh.O. His comedy album, Grown Man-Baby Steps is a favorite on Sirius XM.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Sid Davis - Baggage Claim
programme.desc: This former airline worker hilariously unloads side-splitting baggage on stage. Sid's humor is fueled with A.D.D., a wavering ego, and a grade school teacher wife who views him as a child left behind.

programme.title: Daniel Eachus - A Mild and Skinny Guy
programme.desc: Daniel Eachus talks about weird jobs, strange fears, and how to prank restaurants all through the lens of being the lifelong skinny guy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Alex Velluto - Thirsty
programme.desc: Alex Velluto is a stand-up comedian and Diet Coke drinker from Salt Lake City, Utah. He has performed at comedy festivals all over the country including the Boston Comedy Festival, Big Sky Comedy Festival, and the Seattle International Comedy Competition. He was named “Best of Fest” at the Golden Spike Comedy Festival and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. In 2016, Alex was voted “Best Comedian” by City Weekly Magazine. His debut comedy special “Alex Velluto: Spurious” is currently streaming on Amazon.com.

programme.title: Jason Hewlett - Father Time
programme.desc: The Award-Winning One-Man Show of Jason Hewlett The Entertainer will have you laughing until it hurts. Comedy, Music, Impressions, and Standing Ovations make Jason the perfect entertainer. His brand of Hilarious G-Rated Entertainment is unlike anything you have ever enjoyed. Over 2,000 shows for more than 1 Million audience members in his incredible career make Jasonís show an event you will remember for years to come.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Nazareth - American by Choice
programme.desc: Award Winning Comedian Nazareth, has been seen by over 40 Million people around the world through live concerts, TV and Radio broadcasts. His list of TV appearances include: Comedy Central, ABC Family, NBC, CBS, and TBN.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Brian Bates - Uber Important
programme.desc: Turning to comedy after twenty years in corporate America, Brian Bates jokes about ubering his hecklers home, meeting women while hiking, and people who dont believe in God but do believe in wrestling.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Poolos - One Wife, Two Daughters, and Zero Influence
programme.desc: Mark stands 6'7" weighs in at 350 technically a giant however he is very weak and a wimp. In his routines, he weaves the story of his life as a bumbling jolly giant in his fast engaging storytelling style. He has been compared to Louie Anderson. Mark is a true road dog, performing in 40 states and all across Canada. Mark's ultimate dream is to do a film that people actually will have seen.

programme.desc: From Wisconsin, where people speak backwards, Kathleen Dunbar comes to Dry Bar with a wake up call for anyone 20 and younger.

programme.title: The Green Ninja
